title: Harry and William have 'good and bad days' as he talks feud rumours
text:
Prince Harry stated that he loves his brother ‘dearly’ (Picture: Rex/ PA)

Prince Harry has said he and his brother the Duke of Cambridge have ‘good days and bad days’ as they embark on ‘different paths’.

The Duke of Sussex was asked about his alleged feud with Prince William during the ITV documentary Harry & Meghan: An African Journey.

He told journalist Tom Bradby that ‘inevitably stuff happens’ when carrying out such a high-profile role in a high-profile family.

Harry said: ‘We are brothers. We will always be brothers. We are certainly on different paths at the moment but I will always be there for him as I know he will always be there for me.

‘We don’t see each other as much as we used to, because we are so busy, but I love him dearly.

He opened up about their alleged feud (Picture: ITV)

The documentary followed Meghan and Harry’s time in Africa (Picture: Getty Images)

‘The majority of the stuff is created out of nothing, but as brothers, you know, you have good days, you have bad days.’

Harry, Meghan, William and Kate were previously referred to as the ‘Fab Four’ after they worked on charity organisation The Royal Foundation together.

But earlier this year it was announced that the two couples would be parting ways, with only the Cambridges left looking after the company.

At the time, both parties denied reports of a feud, stating instead that the move was ‘largely about preparing both couples for their future roles, which are obviously on divergent tracks’.

Meghan and Harry have since gone on to establish their own new charitable foundation.

During the documentary of their Africa tour, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex also discussed life as new parents while living in the public eye.

Describing the last year as ‘hard’, Meghan revealed she had been warned by British friends not to marry Harry.

Harry and William have faced rumours of a falling out this year (Picture: Getty Images)

Meghan also talked about life as a new mum in the spotlight (Picture: ITV)

She said: ‘I don’t think anybody could understand that, but in all fairness I had no idea, which probably sounds difficult to understand.

‘When I first met my now-husband my friends were really happy because I was so happy, but my British friends said to me, “I’m sure he’s great but you shouldn’t do it because the British tabloids will destroy your life”.’

Meghan added that being a royal had been ‘complicated’, stating that it isn’t enough ‘just to survive something, you’ve got to thrive, you’ve got to feel happy’.

The duchess said: ‘I tried to adopt the British sensibility of the stiff upper lip. What that does internally is probably really damaging.’

She added: ‘I never thought this would be easy but I thought it would be fair and that is the part that is hard to reconcile, but I just take each day as it comes.’

Referring to her husband as H throughout her interview, she noted: ‘The good thing is that I have got my baby and I have got my husband and they are the best.’

description: Prince Harry has said he and his brother the Duke of Cambridge have 'good days' and 'bad days' as they embark on 'different paths'.
